     <h3>
      Contribute to CJCJ
     </h3>
     <p>
      Make a difference to youth and adults trying to get their lives back on track.
     </p>
     <p>
      <a class="donate" href="https://www.networkforgood.org/donation/ExpressDonation.aspx?ORGID2=943136811">
       Donate
      </a>
     </p>
     <div>
      <div>
       <hr/>
       <img class="mceItemNoResize" src="/uploads/cjcj/images/after_the_doors.jpg"/>
      </div>
      <h3>
       New Book!
      </h3>
      <h3>
       <a href="https://rowman.com/ISBN/9781442246720/After-the-Doors-Were-Locked-A-History-of-Youth-Corrections-in-California-and-the-Origins-of-Twenty-First-Century-Reform">
        After the Doors Were Locked
       </a>
      </h3>
      <p>
       Purchase CJCJ Executive Director Daniel Macallair's new book, a history of youth corrections in California, detailing the cycle of abuse and reform from the 1890s to the present.
      </p>
      <hr/>
     </div>
     <div>
      <a href="/Next-Generation-Fellowship.html">

      </a>
     </div>
     <p>
      <span>
       NGF is a two-day leadership development and policy advocacy training for formerly incarcerated or justice-involved individuals.
      </span>
     </p>

    <div class="panel panel-bottom">
     <h3>
      About CJCJ
     </h3>
     <p>
      Established in 1985 as the Western Regional Office of the National Center on Institutions and Alternatives (NCIA), the Center on Juvenile and Criminal Justice (CJCJ) is a nonprofit nonpartisan organization promoting a balanced and humane criminal justice system through the provision of direct services, technical assistance, and policy analysis.
     </p>
